thread.title: Linehan, Penny lead Idaho past Louisiana-Monroe, 27-13
thread.title_full: Linehan, Penny lead Idaho past Louisiana-Monroe, 27-13

title: Linehan, Penny lead Idaho past Louisiana-Monroe, 27-13
text:
Linehan, Penny lead Idaho past Louisiana-Monroe, 27-13 AP Oct 24, 2015 at 9:04p ET 0Shares 
MOSCOW, Idaho (AP) Matt Linehan threw three touchdown passes and Elijhaa Penny finished with 184 yards rushing on 36 carries - both career highs - to help Idaho beat Louisiana-Monroe 27-13 Saturday. 
Linehan was 23-of-39 passing for 315 yards including second-half touchdowns of 34 and 23 yards to Deon Watson . 
The Vandals (3-4, 2-2 Sun Belt), who beat Troy 19-16 last Saturday, won back-to-back games for the first time since Oct. 2009. Their three wins are the most in a season since 2010. 
Louisiana-Monroe (1-6, 0-3) tied it at 13 with 9:03 left in the third quarter when Craig Ford kicked his second field goal, a 31-yarder. 
Idaho responded with a nine-play, 79-yard drive capped by Watson's first touchdown less than three minutes later. 
The Warhawks went three-and-out on their next two possessions before turning it over on downs on their final two drives. 0
